source:
Theorem 3.4.13 (Principle of Inclusion Exclusion for 2 Sets)
Given two sets,|A1|and|A2|
|A1∪A2|=|A1|+|A2|−|A1∩A2|
question: If set \( A_1 \) has 5 elements, set \( A_2 \) has 7 elements, and the intersection \( |A_1 \cap A_2| \) has 2 elements, how many elements are in the union \( |A_1 \cup A_2| \)?
solution:
Using the principle of inclusion-exclusion for two sets:

\[
|A_1 \cup A_2| = |A_1| + |A_2| - |A_1 \cap A_2|
\]

Substituting the values:

\[
|A_1 \cup A_2| = 5 + 7 - 2 = 10
\]

Thus, the number of elements in the union is \( \boxed{10} \).
